The reaction of (η 5-C 5H 5)Co(PPh 3) 2 ( 1) with 1,3-bis(isopropyl)imidazol-2-ylidene (Im
i Pr 2, 17) leads to the formation of (η 5-C 5H 5)Co(PPh 3)(Im
i Pr 2) ( 5) in 69% yield. N-Heterocyclic carbene 17 also undergoes reaction with (η 5-C 5H 5)Co(CO) 2 ( 9) to give (η 5-C 5H 5)Co(Im
i Pr 2)(CO) ( 6) in 30% yield. The barrier to rotation about the Co−C carbene bond in 6 has been determined by variable-temperature 1H NMR spectroscopy (13.6 kcal/mol) and by computation (13.3 kcal/mol). Complex 5 undergoes reaction with PhSSPh to give the paramagnetic thiolato complex (η 5-C 5H 5)Co(Im
i Pr 2)(SPh) ( 7), which is oxidized to the metallosulfone complex (η 5-C 5H 5)Co(Im
i Pr 2)(SO 2Ph) ( 8). The solid-state structures of 5− 8 were determined by X-ray crystallography. The structural and dynamic properties of 6, (η 5-C 5H 5)Co(ImMe 2)(CO) (ImMe 2 = 1,3-dimethylimidazol-2-ylidene), and (η 5-C 5H 5)Co(ImAr 2)(CO) (ImAr 2 = 1,3-dimesityl-2-ylidene) were examined by quantum chemistry calculations.
